description.narrative: The national education management bodies, both central and decentralized, are strengthened., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,children aged 3-15 years, girls and boys, are in a supportive environment and benefit from inclusive quality education that integrates local distinctiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The national education management bodies, both central and decentralized, are strengthened.

description.narrative: ProDEG 2019–2028 is now in place and has brought a renewed vision for the education system's development. The transfer of education competency to local authorities is becoming a reality, particularly in convergence municipalities, where mayors have been empowered and made responsible for the achievement of education local governance and where DSEEs have had their capacities strengthened to support schools and teachers to deliver quality education. An agreement between both the Ministries of Education and of Territorial Administration and Decentralization defines roles and responsibilities in the school-building process considering the new law concerning the decentralization reform. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of school maps available up to date in each of the 40 CCs
System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
Number of meetings per year of the Education Sector Group with report
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
Availability of COVID-19 sectoral riposte plan
Availability of a risk reduction strategy as part of the education sector's COVID-19 plan/policy
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education sector analysis, financial simulation model or medium term expenditure framework developed with UNICEF support
